Its base damage and ap scaling are pretty poor for a 10 second cd, 130 mana cost ability. It can't even clear the caster minions. Other mages' main damage/waveclear spells for comparison:

{{champion:99}} E - 10s cooldown, 240 base and 60% AP scaling. 130 mana.
{{champion:61}} W - 9s cooldown, 250 base and 70% AP scaling. 110 mana.
{{champion:134}} Q - 4s cooldown, 264.5 base and 69.5% AP scaling. 80 mana.
{{champion:101}} Q - 5s cooldown, 240 base and 75% AP scaling. 120 mana.
{{champion:115}} Q - 4s cooldown, 255 base and 65% AP scaling. 70 mana.
{{champion:112}} E - 9s cooldown, 250 base and 70% AP scaling. With evolution, 350 base and 98% AP scaling. 110 mana.
{{champion:103}} Q - 7s cooldown, 280 base and 70% AP scaling, with half of that being true damage. 85 mana.

In every case, Lux's E has the lowest base damage, lowest AP scaling, highest cooldown, and highest mana cost. All of these abilities aside from her E clears the casters in one cast. In other words, her E doesn't kill a single minion by itself until late game, which lets her be shoved under tower and roamed on. This is actually a huge indirect nerf in season 5 due to minions' buffed health, which took away her ability to wave clear but not that of other mages.

Yes, it has utility, but most of the time the slow on it is lost because you either detonate it immediately or the enemy walks out of it. Vision is good, but I think the downsides are too many for too few upsides. On a 10 second cd, I don't think upping the damage a tiny bit so it can kill caster minions is going to break it.

Edit: made a mistake with Viktor Q vs E. It's been fixed.

Note: Oriannas wave clear requires two spells or poor positioning, and when used aggressively is fairly easy to evade. Lux's waveclear skill can be charged to do hit a wave that essentially isnt smart enough to avoid it, and when used to poke, it is increadibly hard to dodge even just the base damage, plus her passive can be dropped on top. I've never liked the skill, but I accept it for what it is. Lux is a support who can mid, she doesn't need a buff, unlike orianna or Morgana that have similar support functionality, they can't freely swap between the two lanes as easily as Lux can, or be a damage dealing support, or go mid and give massive shield buffs to allies in teamfights followed by ultimate. Have you ever faced a team with lux and morganna, or lux and jannah. The two are basically tanks with the constant shield drops and massive CC

Morgana swaps between lanes much more easily than Lux does. In fact, she's been played in all 3 lanes in the LCS. Orianna has gotten some picks mid, but never support. Lux hasn't really gotten any picks at all. Lux support is pretty subpar, and apparently the pros don't think Lux mid is worth it either.

Since when did Viktor's Q deal extra damage when evolved? It just gives him a movement speed boost. I think you meant his E, which in this case, only deals full damage if they sit in it. Also, it doesn't slow. I can argue with most of these that they don't slow.

orianna's waveclear is a combo of Q+W (usually for the caster minions, then another Q is tossed at the melees to clean those up)
Syndra's waveclear is a combination of Q+W+E (not necessarily in that order)
Xerath Q clears the backline, but he still usually has to clear the tanky melee minions with W
1 Ziggs Q does not clear a minion wave. Ever. Usually E is thrown in (or additional Q's).
Viktor doesn't use Q for waveclear. I think that's a typo and you're talking about E. E is not even *half* the cast range of Lux's E. (compare Lucent Singularity's 1100 cast range to Death Ray's 525 cast range). Really Vitkor should be classed a short range mage like Annie/Swain/Cass (but unlike those dudes, he builds pure squishy due to the durability granted from his Q)
Ahri I don't play, but usually when I see her clearing a wave, it's Q+W plus a bunch of autos.

Twisted Fate's Q is a much better comparison for waveclear. I see it commonly oneshot the whole wave (or at least the caster minions) Although technically wildcards is entirely damage. It does not slow, it does not grant vision (I've killed a lot of people in the fog of war randomly because of wildcards hitting them which is why I know this).
Cassiopeia's QW+EEEEEEEE not only clears the wave, but gives % max mana back. Usually she stays at full mana because of this. this does require Cass to be farmed/fed to achieve.
Zed tends to build armour pen/botrk. neither of which enhance his waveclear than building flat AD would (armour pen doesn't increase damage against targets with 0 armour; which minions have 0 armour, and also BotRK gives 25 AD, which is tiny).
Lulu isn't even played solo lane anymore (or played in general), but her Q has a much lower mana cost (and also much lower damage, but a much stronger slow).

Lux's cooldown being greater isn't by much. Most of these abilities have cooldowns ranging from 15 seconds to 6 seconds. And Lux's E is a flat 10 seconds at all ranks (which beats most of these abilities through ranks 1-4 in cooldown). Even then, we're talking about a 1 second difference in most scenarios.

It would be nice if the base damage at rank 5 of lucent singularity could oneshot the caster minions. I've had it happen before where I could oneshot the minion backline (but only when very fed).

And the moment you do cast and detonate the E they can even stand on their minions for a nice 9ish seconds if they want before having to move away.

And all that safe range crap means nothing when you have to walk into AA range to actually finish the minions off. Cut her E's mana cost AND range in half and I bet you most Lux players would rejoice. Safely poking enemy champions doesn't mean anything if you still can't kill them and you can't farm minions at all.

I think the best comparison to Lux is Morgana.
Both have almost identical kit except for R.
Both have root with different duration and number allowed, both are line skillshot.
Both have area denial with long duration, both are circle skillshot.
Both have shield with different effect.

I did some suggestions before, so I'll repeat here again.
Morgana W alone can kill ranged minions. Lvl 3 with small ap ( doran ring ) + game time < around 10 minutes, her W can kill ranged minions. At lvl 4, she won't need ap items at all to do it.
At later stage of the game, her W alone can clear a wave with some positioning to include siege and melee, and add her Q to siege one.

Lux require some change to be like that since unlike other mages who can combo their kit to wave clear, she don't have combo for wave clear unless you want to R a minion wave every 30 sec. ( you call her R as low cd skill ? Try Blitzcrank )
And no, she don't have ability to clear entire wave since she only able to triggering her passive for 4 times depend on her attack speed which I think no one will build for her. 

Here is the suggestions for her E :
- make enemy effected by her E receive more damage depend on how long enemy stand inside her E.

Reason : 
Look at Morgana, range minion keep standing still for entire W duration. Her W mechanic is a DOT with recalculation for bonus damage depend on missing HP, more dying = more damage.
So let's change Lux mechanic to some kind like that. Rather a DOT, keep her detonation control but allow detonation damage to scale depend on how long enemy stand inside the field. Example : 5 sec standing still = 100% more damage.
Number can be tweaked to be like Morgana entire W duration total damage. 

This can help her damage output vs champs too.
Morgana poke combo usually is Q + W.... and that's painful enough depend on Q duration and W lvl. She can continue with self E + R.
Lux is quite the same, Q + E. But without AA trigger which technically she need to do with her W on, the damage is quite small. 
Of course you can snipe with R, but once again, you need to AA trigger R effect for more damage. 
Early game, triggering AA is quite less painful for Lux. At late game, try to do it can result in suicide.
Think of the suggestion as reward for being able to trap enemy inside E field.
